stories.text: Our class is having an election for class president. This is an example of **democracy**, where we all get to vote. We are starting a **campaign** to tell everyone our ideas. Before the election, our teacher **appointed** Mia as the temporary leader. It's a big job. She has to help when things get **chaotic**, like when everyone is talking at once. Her main rule is to **confine** all running and shouting to the playground, not the classroom.

Hi Team,

I know this first week at the new office was incredibly **chaotic**! Papers were everywhere, and the phones never stopped ringing. The company is in the middle of a huge new advertising **campaign**, so everyone is busy.

I was **appointed** as the junior coordinator, which means I help organize you all. For now, please try to **confine** your questions to email so I can keep track. I promise this company is a great place to work; it has a strong feeling of **democracy**, and the boss actually listens to everyone's opinion.

Best,
Alex

The transition from a monarchy to a full **democracy** was not a smooth process for the nation. After the revolution, the new government **appointed** a special committee to write a constitution. However, their first goal was to **confine** the powers of the new leader, to ensure no single person could become a tyrant. The situation in the capital remained **chaotic** for months, with different groups fighting for control. To win public support, the interim leaders launched a massive information **campaign** to explain the benefits of the new system.

The mayor's latest urban renewal project has been criticized as being more of a publicity **campaign** than a genuine effort to help citizens. Critics argue that the project seems designed to **confine** the city's poorest residents to specific zones, rather than integrating them. The problems worsened when the mayor **appointed** a personal friend, who lacks experience, to oversee the budget. This has led to a **chaotic** allocation of resources, and the entire action fundamentally undermines the principles of social **democracy** that he claims to support.

Hey, are you okay? You seem **alienated** from everyone at lunch. You sat all alone. I have a strange **conception** of what might be wrongâ€”did you have a fight with Sam? I know he can be **combative** and likes to argue. He **demanded** that I choose a side, which isn't fair. How about we get a **combination** of snacks after school and talk?

My original **conception** of this recipe was that it would be very simple. I was wrong! This dish **demanded** much more attention than I expected. The flavor is a perfect **combination** of sweet and spicy. Be careful with the ginger, though. If you add too much, the taste becomes very strong and **combative**, almost fighting with the other spices. I don't want you to feel **alienated** from cooking, so I promise my next recipe will be much easier!

Our initial **conception** of the project was too ambitious. The client **demanded** a final product by next week, which was unrealistic. This impossible deadline created a tense, **combative** atmosphere in the office, with teams blaming each other. As a result, the design team felt completely **alienated** from the process and stopped sharing their ideas. The only path forward is a **combination** of a new timeline and better communication.

The protagonist's deeply **alienated** state is the engine of the novel. His entire **conception** of the world is shaped by his isolation. This alienation isn't passive; it's a **combative** stance against a society he feels has rejected him. The author skillfully **demanded** that the reader sit with this discomfort, offering no easy answers. The character is a complex **combination** of vulnerability and aggression, making him one of the most compelling figures in modern fiction.

Welcome to the School Pet Club! This is a friendly **association** for all animal lovers. We have a student **committee** that plans fun events. I want to **assure** you that all our pets are friendly. Sometimes our meetings get a little loud, but it's never total **chaos**. Our only rule is that we do not discuss **controversial** topics, like which pet is "better." We are all friends here.

The city is in complete **chaos** following the mayor's speech. The new policy is extremely **controversial**, and many people are angry. The mayor formed a special **committee** to review the policy, but citizens are not satisfied. A spokesperson tried to **assure** the public that their voices were being heard. However, the local citizens' **association** has already planned a large protest for this weekend.

To: All Staff
Re: New Partnership

I want to **assure** everyone that the new partnership with TechCorp will be good for us. I know the decision was **controversial**, but the executive **committee** voted unanimously in favor. This **association** will open up new markets for us. I understand there is some fear about job changes, which can create a feeling of **chaos**, but we have a clear plan for a smooth transition.

The historical **committee** reviewing the artifacts made a highly **controversial** decision to re-date the items. This decision has thrown the entire timeline of the period into **chaos**, effectively rewriting history. The evidence relies on a tenuous **association** between two previously unconnected sites. While the authors **assure** their readers that their methodology is sound, the academic community remains deeply divided over these radical claims.

When Dr. Elias Vance was **appointed** to the governing board of the Historical Integrity **Association**, he believed it to be the pinnacle of his career. This esteemed **committee**, a self-proclaimed bastion of academic **democracy**, was tasked with preserving the nationâ€™s founding narratives.

However, Vanceâ€™s initial **conception** of the group as a body of objective scholars quickly dissolved. He found their work to be a strange **combination** of rigorous research and willful blindness to inconvenient truths. His attempts to introduce new, albeit **controversial**, evidence were met with a frosty, unwelcoming silence.

His nature was not passive; it was intellectually **combative**. He couldn't just sit by. He openly **demanded** a review of the societyâ€™s most cherished publications, labeling them as flawed. This, of course, did not endear him to the old guard. He soon found himself completely **alienated** from the inner circle, his memos unanswered.

In response, Vance initiated what could only be described as an internal **campaign** for reform. He bypassed the leadership and presented his findings directly to the junior members. The result was predictable: utter **chaos**. The organization, once a place of quiet consensus, became a battlefield of academic warfare.

The established members tried to **confine** the damage, limiting his access to archives and restricting his speaking time at symposia. The situation became so **chaotic** that the chairwoman had to intervene. She tried to **assure** the members that proper procedure would be followed, but the trust within the institution was already broken.

The police finally caught the **kidnappers** who took the rich man's son. They had to ask the **military** for help because the bad guys had big guns. This story was in the **headlines** of every newspaper today. The criminals were caught and **imprisoned** in a strong jail. Now, the city is safe and people can live in **harmony** again.

I just watched a great movie! It was all over the **headlines** last week. The story is about a group of **kidnappers** who steal a famous painting. The government sends a special **military** team to stop them. In the end, the bad guys are **imprisoned** for a long time. The final scene shows the hero returning home to live in **harmony** with his family. It was very exciting!

Achieving social **harmony** in this region has become increasingly difficult. The government has increased its **military** presence on the streets to maintain order. Many protesters claim they were falsely accused and **imprisoned** without a fair trial. The daily **headlines** are filled with stories of conflict and fear. Some rebel groups are even acting like **kidnappers**, taking civilians hostage to demand money from the state.

The sudden **military** coup shocked the international community. The democratically elected president was immediately **imprisoned** in an undisclosed location. Observers described the junta not as leaders, but as political **kidnappers** holding the nation's future ransom. These dramatic events dominated global **headlines** for weeks. The prospect of restoring domestic **harmony** seems distant, as the population remains deeply divided and fearful of further repression.

I read a sad book about the **cruelties** of hurting animals. It made me cry, but my mom said it is **permissible** to show feelings. The book **consists** of five true stories. It explains a strange **phenomenon**: why some people treat pets badly. I want to make a small **contribution** of money to help the animal shelter next week.

I believe that true happiness **consists** in helping others. It is a common **phenomenon** that giving makes you feel better than receiving. That is why I made a **contribution** to a charity yesterday. They work hard to stop the **cruelties** of child labor in factories. I asked the manager if it is **permissible** for me to bring my friends to volunteer next time, and she said yes!

Dr. Lee's major **contribution** to modern medicine was discovering a new vaccine. He often said that scientific success **consists** of 99% hard work and 1% luck. It is now **permissible** for other labs to use his data for research. He spent his life studying the **phenomenon** of how viruses spread rapidly. His goal was to end the **cruelties** of the disease that had caused so much suffering.

In a civilized society, we must constantly ask what actions are legally and morally **permissible** during times of conflict. True peace **consists** of justice and equality, not merely the absence of fighting. We cannot simply turn a blind eye to the **cruelties** suffered by refugees at our borders. Their potential **contribution** to our economy and culture is often overlooked by critics. Mass displacement is a global **phenomenon** that requires a coordinated, humane response.

My father works for a large **corporation** in the city. Yesterday, he brought home a new toy that was **designed** by his team. He gave it to me as a **token** of his love. It is a castle, and I used extra blocks to **fortify** the walls to make them strong. My sister thinks the castle is ugly, but I think beauty is **subjective**, so I don't mind her opinion.

Please accept this gift basket as a **token** of our appreciation. We know that taste in food is **subjective**, but we hope you find something you like inside. This special package was **designed** just for our VIP clients. We hope to **fortify** our relationship with you in the coming year. Our **corporation** is committed to providing you with the best service possible.

The new headquarters was **designed** to be the safest building in the city. The owner is a major global **corporation** that deals with sensitive data. They built thick walls to **fortify** the structure against any physical attacks. Critics argue about the building's aesthetics; some say it looks powerful, while others say it looks scary, proving that art is **subjective**. The company also built a public park nearby as a **token** of goodwill to the neighborhood.

The general attempted to **fortify** the morale of his troops before the decisive battle. He argued that fear is a **subjective** emotion that can be mastered with discipline. The army was run like a ruthless **corporation**, prioritizing efficiency over individual welfare. The medal of honor was often seen as a mere **token** for the immense sacrifices soldiers made. The entire military campaign was **designed** not for defense, but to expand the empire's influence aggressively.

The annual charity gala hosted by the Zenith **corporation** was dominating the **headlines** for weeks. The event took place in a magnificent glass pavilion **designed** to symbolize transparency and global **harmony**. However, the evening's elegance was shattered by a shocking **phenomenon**: a sudden blackout followed by the intrusion of armed men.

The wealthy guests found themselves effectively **imprisoned** within the ballroom as the security doors locked down. Outside, the police requested **military** support to **fortify** the perimeter and prevent an escape. Inside, the leader of the intrudersâ€”identified later as political **kidnappers** who had seized the CEOâ€”began to speak.

He passionately described the hidden **cruelties** inflicted by the company's factories abroad. He argued that while their violent methods might not be legally **permissible**, they were morally necessary. He proclaimed that true accountability **consists** not in charity, but in transparency.

The leader mocked the gala as a mere **token**, claiming it was a distraction rather than a genuine **contribution** to society. As the night wore on, the debate among the hostages regarding the intruders' morality became intensely **subjective**, blurring the line between villain and hero.

My dog, Max, thinks the entire garden is his **territory**. Whenever the mailman comes close to the gate, Max barks loudly. The poor mailman usually runs away in **terror**. I **consulted** a dog trainer about this problem yesterday. She said we need to **reform** Max's behavior with some training. I hope being strict won't **spoil** his happy personality, but he needs to learn.

Last month, I decided to **reform** my bad eating habits. I **consulted** a doctor to get some professional advice. He warned me that eating too much sugar would **spoil** my teeth and health. Going to the gym was new **territory** for me, and I felt nervous at first. To be honest, I had a feeling of **terror** when I saw the heavy weights, but now I love exercising.

The CEO made a sudden decision that threatened to **spoil** the company's reputation. He hadn't **consulted** the board of directors before acting. Many managers felt he was stepping on their **territory** and ignoring their authority. The news caused absolute **terror** among the investors, and the stock price dropped immediately. Now, the shareholders are demanding a plan to **reform** the management structure to prevent this from happening again.

The dictator's regime relied on psychological **terror** to suppress any opposition. He claimed that the neighboring province was historically his nation's **territory**. Although diplomats were **consulted**, peace talks quickly broke down. The aggressive military moves threatened to **spoil** years of diplomatic progress. International organizations are now pressuring the government to **reform** its foreign policy and respect human rights laws.

I saw two boys fighting in the schoolyard today. I hate **violence** because it scares me. I tried to **dodge** them so I wouldn't get hit. A teacher came to **solve** the problem and stop the fight. She told us that if we are kind, our school will **flourish** and be a happy place. It is hard to **withstand** bullying, but we must be brave.

I'm trying to grow roses in my garden, but the strong wind is a problem. I need to find a way to **solve** this issue. I planted a hedge to help the flowers **withstand** the storms. If I don't protect them, the **violence** of the wind will destroy the petals. I also have to **dodge** bees while I'm working! Hopefully, with my care, the roses will **flourish** this summer.

The young boxer managed to **withstand** a heavy blow in the first round. His opponent was known for his speed and ability to **dodge** punches effortlessly. However, the match was criticized for its excessive **violence**, which some say is bad for the sport. The boxing association is trying to **solve** this by introducing stricter safety rules. They believe that with better regulations, the sport will continue to **flourish** safely.

The nation's economy has shown a remarkable ability to **withstand** global recessions. However, the government cannot simply **dodge** the underlying issues of inequality forever. The recent outbreak of urban **violence** was a symptom of deep social unrest. To ensure that businesses continues to **flourish**, policymakers must address the root causes. There is no simple way to **solve** such complex structural problems without significant reform.

There was a big **scandal** at school today. Someone stole the answers to the math test! I was the only **witness** who saw a boy running out of the teacher's office. The teacher was busy **supervising** the lunchroom at that time. The boy tried to **justify** his actions by saying he was stressed, but the principal said that stealing is wrong. He must face **justice** and accept his punishment.

I love watching the new TV show "Courtroom Drama." In the last episode, a lawyer tried to get **justice** for an innocent man. The man was accused of causing a financial **scandal** at his company. However, a surprise **witness** appeared and told the truth. It turned out his boss, who was **supervising** the accounts, stole the money. The boss couldn't **justify** why the funds were missing and went to jail.

As a manager **supervising** a large team, you must set a good example. Any hint of a **scandal** can ruin our department's reputation. Recently, we had to fire an employee for dishonesty. He tried to **justify** lying on his report, claiming everyone does it. However, we cannot ignore such behavior. To ensure **justice** for hardworking staff, we must be fair. If you **witness** any unethical actions, please report them immediately.

The senator's career ended in disgrace following the corruption **scandal**. For years, he had been responsible for **supervising** the allocation of public funds. Critics argue that he used his power to enrich his friends, unable to **justify** the exorbitant expenses. The public demanded **justice**, calling for a full investigation. A key **witness** has now come forward with documents that could permanently destroy the senator's legacy.

The task of **supervising** the International Tribunal fell to Chief Prosecutor Elena Vance. She was determined to **solve** the mystery behind the "Midnight Purge," an event that had instilled absolute **terror** in the populace for a decade. The defendant, ex-Minister Kael, attempted to **dodge** culpability during the cross-examination, using rhetorical gymnastics to evade direct answers.

He tried to **justify** his authorized use of state **violence**, arguing it was the only necessary evil to ensure the nation would **flourish** amidst the chaos of civil war. However, the trial took a dramatic turn when a massive **scandal** broke: leaked audio tapes proved Kael had treated the state treasury as his private **territory**, siphoning funds for personal gain.

Furthermore, records showed he hadn't **consulted** the cabinet on military strikes but acted unilaterally. A key **witness**, Kael's own brother, took the stand and testified that Kael deliberately plotted to **spoil** the peace treaty to prolong the conflict for profit.

Kael's defense crumbled; it could not **withstand** the weight of the truth. The verdict sparked a wave of relief, paving the way for true institutional **reform**. It was a historic moment where the victims finally saw **justice** served, marking the end of a dark era.

association.definition: Being together or connected with another person as a friend or partner.
association.example: Cathy feels greatly depressed because her parents are opposed to her association with the boy she loves.

alienated.definition: Feeling like you are not part of a group or family; feeling alone.
alienated.example: Parents often feel alienated from their children. There is often a generation gap between parents and children.

appointed.definition: To choose someone for a job or an important position.
appointed.example: Several years later, she was appointed sales manager.

campaign.definition: A plan with many steps to help someone win an election or sell a product.
campaign.example: Florida was a key state in his campaign for re-election.

chaotic.definition: Very messy and not in order; full of confusion.
chaotic.example: The traffic in Taipei was really chaotic before the completion of the MRT.

committee.definition: A group of people from a bigger group who meet to make decisions.
committee.example: The committee consists of twelve members.

combination.definition: Two or more different things that are put or mixed together.
combination.example: It's hard to describe such a feeling. Maybe we can say that it's a combination of love and hatred.

controversial.definition: Causing many people to have strong arguments or disagreements.
controversial.example: Abortion is a highly controversial matter. Many people have strong feelings about it.

demanded.definition: To ask for something in a strong way because you think you must have it.
demanded.example: The opposition parties have demanded that all the facts be made public.

democracy.definition: A way to run a country where the people choose their leaders by voting.
democracy.example: There is a need for more democracy in that country. The citizens still don't have enough rights.

assure.definition: To tell someone that something is true so they do not worry.
assure.example: I assure you that you'll be able to make progress as long as you make an effort.

chaos.definition: A state of being very messy and having no order or control.
chaos.example: The failure of the electricity supplies created complete chaos in the city. Traffic was a mess.

confine.definition: To keep something inside a certain area or on a certain topic.
confine.example: Please confine your remarks to the subject under discussion. Don't talk about other things.

conception.definition: An idea or an understanding of what something is like.
conception.example: He's got a pretty strange conception of friendship. He treats his friends in a cold way.

combative.definition: Ready and wanting to fight or argue with people.
combative.example: He is famous as a(n) combative spokesman for human rights. He's ready and willing to fight.

headlines.definition: The title of a newspaper story printed in large letters.
headlines.example: The new road plan is in the headlines again. It has been the focus of public attention for months now.

harmony.definition: A state of living together peacefully.
harmony.example: Our cat and dog never fight they live together in perfect harmony.

imprisoned.definition: To put someone in a prison or a place they cannot leave.
imprisoned.example: The crew were imprisoned on the plane by hijackers.

consists.definition: To be based on or lie in something.
consists.example: Happiness consists in contentment; therefore, we should cherish what we have now.

kidnappers.definition: People who take someone away by force to get money.
kidnappers.example: The boy's kidnappers demanded an enormous ransom. However, his family could not afford it.

military.definition: Relating to soldiers or the army.
military.example: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.

cruelties.example: People all over the world are aware of the cruelties of war.

permissible.example: She has been exposed to radiation above the permissible level; therefore, she's had health problems.

phenomenon.definition: A fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen.
phenomenon.example: Scientists have studied this strange phenomenon in weather patterns for years.

designed.definition: To draw plans for how something will look or be made.
designed.example: It is said that the magnificent building was designed by a great architect.

contribution.definition: Something that you give or do to help something be successful.
contribution.example: He was respected by all his colleagues, for he had made a very positive contribution to the development of the company.

corporation.example: Jack owns a multinational corporation and is on good terms with many famous businessmen in the world.

subjective.definition: Based on personal feelings rather than facts.
subjective.example: This is a very subjective judgment of her abilities. It's not fair.

token.definition: A thing that you give or do to show your feelings.
token.example: Please accept this small gift as a token of our gratitude.

fortify.definition: To make a place stronger against attack.
fortify.example: They built towers and walls to fortify this village against invasion.

reform.definition: To make changes in something to improve it.
reform.example: The union officials promised to reform working conditions in the factory.

dodge.definition: To avoid something unpleasant or difficult.
dodge.example: Somehow he managed to dodge all the difficult questions. He didn't answer them.

solve.definition: To find the answer to a problem.
solve.example: We are supposed to work together to solve this difficult problem.

spoil.definition: To ruin something or make it less good.
spoil.example: We've had a wonderful day out; let's not spoil it now by having a quarrel.

supervising.definition: To watch a person or activity to make sure that everything is done correctly.
supervising.example: She was busy supervising the cooking and the sewing.

territory.definition: An area of land that belongs to or is controlled by a government or person.
territory.example: You're treading on rather dangerous territory if you mention that incident; it will upset him.

consulted.definition: To ask for information or advice from someone.
consulted.example: Why was I not consulted before you made the decision? I also had some opinions on the matter.

terror.definition: A feeling of being very frightened.
terror.example: She has a look of sheer terror on her face. She looks terrified.

violence.definition: Behavior involving physical force intended to hurt, damage, or kill someone or something.
violence.example: She cited several cases of domestic violence which led to tragedy.

withstand.definition: To be strong enough not to be harmed or destroyed by something.
withstand.example: The troops were too weak to withstand another attack.

justice.definition: Fairness in the way people are treated.
justice.example: To do him justice, we should look into the matter and see if he is really responsible for the accident.

flourish.definition: To grow or develop well and be successful.
flourish.example: It's not easy for any business to flourish in the present economic situation, and many of them may go bankrupt.

justify.definition: To give a good reason for something.
justify.example: People ask the President to justify the new policy. They need an explanation.

witness.definition: A person who sees an event happening, especially a crime or an accident.
witness.example: Evan was the most important witness to the accident, so the prosecutor demanded that he testify in court.

scandal.definition: An action or event that is considered immoral or shocking and causes public anger.
scandal.example: We are sure of his innocence, for there has been no hint of scandal during his time in office.
